awd_titl_txt: Organic Geochemical Signals of Short-Term Climatic and      Environmental Cycles in the California Borderland and Gulf  of California
awd_abstract_narration: Climate changes have an impact on the faunal and floral                    remains in marine sediments.  The variation in the organic                      chemistry of these sedimentary remains then, can be used as                     indices of the fauna and flora and the climate in which these                   organisms lived.                                                                     This project will examine a large number of samples from the               varved sediments of the Santa Barbara and Guaymas Basins for                    alkenone and dinosterol content.  The unsaturation ratio of the                 alkenones will be used to address temperature fluctuations and                  the dinosterol content will be used to assess the dinoflagellate                bloom conditions associated with El Ninyo (El Nino) events.  The                samples have been chosen to optimize the expected  temporal                     variations and to insure preservation of the organic signals in                 varved sediments.  This research will provide unique information                about the plankton productivity and temperature variations                      associated with short term El Ninyo events.
